description: Horizontal-Flow Barrier Package - Simulates thin, vertical, low-permeability features that impede horizontal groundwater flow

variables.name: COMMENT
variables.description: Optional comment lines at beginning of file.
variables.tooltip: Lines starting with '#' are treated as comments and ignored by MODFLOW.

variables.name: NPHFB
variables.description: Number of HFB parameters. 0=no parameters used.
variables.tooltip: Number of named parameters for the HFB package. Typically 0 for direct specification.

variables.name: MXFB
variables.description: Maximum number of horizontal-flow barrier entries.
variables.tooltip: Maximum total number of barrier cells (including those defined through parameters). Determines memory allocation.

variables.name: NHFBNP
variables.description: Number of HFB entries not defined by parameters.
variables.tooltip: Number of barrier cell entries that are directly specified (not through parameter definitions). Read in Dataset 2.

variables.name: Layer
variables.tooltip: Layer containing the horizontal-flow barrier. 1-based index.

variables.name: IROW1
variables.description: Row number of the first cell adjacent to the barrier (1-based).
variables.tooltip: Row of the first of two adjacent cells separated by the barrier.

variables.name: ICOL1
variables.description: Column number of the first cell adjacent to the barrier (1-based).
variables.tooltip: Column of the first of two adjacent cells separated by the barrier.

variables.name: IROW2
variables.description: Row number of the second cell adjacent to the barrier (1-based).
variables.tooltip: Row of the second of two adjacent cells separated by the barrier. Must be adjacent to cell 1.

variables.name: ICOL2
variables.description: Column number of the second cell adjacent to the barrier (1-based).
variables.tooltip: Column of the second of two adjacent cells separated by the barrier. Must be adjacent to cell 1.

variables.name: HYDCHR
variables.description: Hydraulic characteristic of the barrier (1/T). Equals K_barrier / thickness_barrier.
variables.tooltip: Hydraulic characteristic = barrier hydraulic conductivity / barrier thickness. Lower values = greater barrier effect. Units: 1/T.
